Events that occurred on 16 March

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1837 - Mary Wall dies.
1916 - J.R.R. Tolkien receives his degree from the University of Oxford.
1921 - J.R.R. Tolkien is appointed to membership of the Faculty of Arts and the Board of the Faculty Arts at the University of Leeds.
1931 - Philosopher Anthony Kenny is born.
1933 - Tolkien writes a letter to Kenneth Sisam.
1949 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 120.
1954 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 143a.
1964 - Artist Quinton Hoover is born.
1967 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Hans-Jörg Modlmayr.
1972 - Tolkien writes Letter 333.
2004 - The World of Tolkien is published.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 2510:
Borondir is on his way in search of the Éothéod.
T.A. 3019:
Mustering of the Host of the West. Debate of the commanders outside Minas Tirith.
Frodo and Sam travel northward along the Morgai. They look out over the camp to Mount Doom.
